title: Integrating Large Language Models in Political Discourse Studies on Social Media: Challenges of Validating an LLMs-in-the-loop Pipeline | Sociologica
snippet: This Sociologica article mentions Fabio Giglietto as an Associate Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, whose research explores the relationship between information theory, media, digital technologies, and their impact on society. It also references Giglietto's (2024) research, which demonstrated that LLMs outperform fully fine-tuned transformer models in NLP tasks.
description: This Sociologica article discusses the challenges of validating LLMs in political discourse studies on social media and references Fabio Giglietto's research on LLMs, highlighting his work demonstrating that LLMs outperform fully fine-tuned transformer models in NLP tasks.

title: Cracking the code: social data access and the DSA's impact on disinformation research
snippet: This article, co-authored by Fabio Giglietto, discusses the impact of the Digital Services Act (DSA) on social media research, particularly in accessing platform data to study disinformation and algorithmic bias.
description: This article, co-authored by Fabio Giglietto, explores the impact of the Digital Services Act (DSA) on social media research and platform data access related to disinformation and algorithmic bias.

title: How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: This article mentions Fabio Giglietto's research on how actors respond to social media platforms' attempts to crack down on coordinated behavior, focusing on COVID-19 mis- and disinformation in Italy. He is quoted as an associate professor at the University of Urbino.
description: The Media Ecosystems Analysis Group article/podcast discusses Fabio Giglietto's research on how actors respond to social media platforms' crackdowns on coordinated disinformation, specifically regarding COVID-19 misinformation in Italy.

title: "META HAS PROMOTED HOMOPHOBIC, RACIST, AND FAKE NEWS POSTS" - YouTube
snippet: Elisabetta Piccolotti mentions a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino demonstrating how META has favored homophobic, racist, or fake news posts over content from politicians. She claims this influences elections globally.
description: A YouTube video where Elisabetta Piccolotti discusses a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino about META's promotion of harmful content. The study suggests this influences global elections.

title: L’articolo 21 nella gabbia di Facebook - Terzogiornale

Scientists Around the World Call to Protect Research on One of Humanity's Greatest Short-term Threats: Disinformation
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, University of Urbino, Italy, is listed as one of the scientists who signed a call to protect research on disinformation.
description: An article from techpolicyPress lists Fabio Giglietto of the University of Urbino, Italy, as one of the scientists who signed a call to protect research on disinformation.
